publication.abstract: Summary: We introduce Paircoil2, a new version of the Paircoil program, which uses pairwise residue probabilities to detect coiled-coil motifs in protein sequence data. Paircoil2 achieves 98% sensitivity and 97% specificity on known coiled coils in leave-family-out cross-validation. It also shows superior performance compared with published methods in tests on proteins of known structure. Â© The Author 2005. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.
publication.title: Paircoil2: Improved prediction of coiled coils from sequence

summary.description: The Paircoil2 program predicts coiled-coil domains in protein sequences by using pairwise residue correlations obtained from a coiled-coil database. The original Paircoil program is still available for use.
summary.name: Paircoil2
